DQy1MSDR0dAwkfN0noDVCg.text: Proper old school English grub. Cheap and cheerful with a no frills shop. If you want authentic London Pie and mash, this is the place for you. Really good puddings too (dare I say it, but maybe better than their meat pies?)

nuZzympWmfzB6X_x6EsB0Q.text: Pukka place for grub, atmosphere is proper London and the pie, mash and liquor is fab.

KbMRlYATekzfT0wwTwVjLg.text: Authentic as good as it gets British pies and mash.  Really enjoyed the Steak and Ale pie with an Old Rascal cider.  Friendly staff.

5zixekt7xpGVVxjiOL70iw.text: Goddards Pie and Mash have been around since 1880's, serving traditional pies with a unique liquer. They were based at Greenwich High St, but the premises were too small. They now hold a food bar at Fountain Court.I love it. It is alfresco dining with table-bench seating. The pies are full of sculenct meats and gravy. The mash it self is homemade with all the taste. They also offer homemade apple and ruburb pies, with custard or ice cream.Its all good food in a busy town, certainly gets you ready for your shopping day or sight-seeing. Try it.

rnEZpDXzj5EJbDOWNlGXBQ.text: Pie and Mash is a British classic though I'm ashamed to say that before last week I hadn't tried it. Goddard's was the perfect place to start.The staff were upbeat and friendly, quick to serve and always with a smile. The shop itself is quite small with pew bench seating, though there is a larger seating area upstairs. The decor is classic; late Victorian tiles and vintage signs. The food is delicious for what it is - pie and mash isn't exactly high dining. The delight is in its simplicity. I had the steak and ale with mash and gravy, though there are a large range of pies available (chicken and ham, classic minced beef etc), as well as a large variety of serving options - double pie, double mash etc. I sampled the liquor but decided against it - I think I need to ease myself into the pie and mash game slowly. If you're still feeling peckish after your savoury pie Goddards have a variety of dessert pies - cherry pie, apple pie and that great British classic, crumble. All available with ice cream or, of course, custard.The shop also do a takeaway service, as well as a range of cold and hot drinks.

w-NuN54N4NrwL_6RKkBcog.text: I would describe this place as a pocket of the North. In the south. It's good food. Nice, if busy atmosphere, the staff are fu**ing awesome though. Seriously. They're ace. Bloke cleaning tables is a hero. Woman who served me charmed me right off. Random guy waiting by the stairs for something put a smile on my face. Decent pie (didn't change my life, but good) but generally I would go here if I fancy pie and mash. I won't get much better. Definitely not for less than a fiver. If you're in a big group you may have trouble.

4O5F63N2qUerYNbInE-zsQ.text: The only pie and mash shop I've ever been to but also (I hear) one of the best around.Really reasonable, generous portions and lots of variety on the menu.Staff are very friendly and accommodating.Perfect location, in between the market and the park - they do take away so you can each in the park on a nice day or ask for it frozen or cold if you want to travel far and cook later!

83zyYbJSvvM51p2Ec2Kd7A.text: This place is a classic! Lovely historical pie and mash shop right at Greenwich market. Famous for their sweet pies and crumbles too, which are served piping hot with yummy custard.The whole 'historic pie shop' deal makes me think of Sweeney Todd. Well, minus the human pies. I hope.

1tLLwqDfoips9QYndaBmhA.text: Does the job, but is it special?  I don't think so.  Very much an assembly line, super busy on a sunny Sunday.

UBdxtCupNSny-98YVO8WRg.text: This place is so English and I love it. There was a line out the door and everything was served with a pile of mashed potato. We got our pies to go, which meant that the wonderful person behind the counter gave us a takeaway coffee cup full of gravy to go with them.A. Cup. Full. Of. Gravy. It was great gravy.The pies were delicious, and the serving sizes super generous. And the price is very right - we got 2 pies with mash and a sausage roll for less than 10 quid!

jL9Z_1TRi5yeeGxvi9LZ3Q.text: We brought the kids in after visiting the Prime Meridian just down the way. Of course we ordered the pie, mash, and eels.  We're from California. So this was not our typical fare.  We got the eels cold, and they we're pretty good but lots of bones, we weren't quite prepared.  The mashed potatoes with gravy we're just about as good as you can imagine!  The pies we're good, the kids particular liked the chicken.  I thought the crust was a bit soggy, but the chicken was tender and flavorful. The kids liked sitting in the booth downstairs watching other people come in to order.  I ordered a cider for the drink menu and it was a good choice, I'd recommend it over beer, for sure.

photos.caption: Photo of Goddards at Greenwich - London, United Kingdom. Pie, mash, and eels.

5qBVbWzbHJgG-XNFNrHFFg.text: I remember visiting the old Goddards in Greenwich just around the corner before they moved out many times (was taken over by Gourmet Burger). It was a genuine local institution. Full of old-school characters from across SE London.The new Goddards is on the site of the old Cricketers pub, just inside Greenwich market. They've done well to retain some of the old features. The interior is pleasant and it's worth heading upstairs once you've ordered and paid for your "double bubble" to see some of the old photos.Obviously it's not fine dining, but it does what it says on the tin. Proper old fashioned pie n mash with lashing of green liquor over the top!

H_0Qrt-cR1rstA0afQ8Osw.text: The beef pie was a little bland, but the chicken pie was great ! I quite liked the mash but you'll want to add a little salt. Mushy peas were okay, a bit more mint please. Anyway a very pleasant experience and for under £5 a head, stunning value.

photos.caption: Photo of Goddards at Greenwich - London, United Kingdom. Dining space is limited, but it all works out.
Photo of Goddards at Greenwich - London, United Kingdom. Pie and mash for under 4 !

NNMDgHhK6bgQQljQltvzyA.text: I gave it 4 stars so long as you know that this is a peoples eating house where simple food is served - brown, hot, OK tasting, and fills you up for a great price. Its not fine dining! But in its class, it's very good.

r5p0pnax6hBpubySk_bBBg.text: Good "fast" traditional English food served in a traditional setting. The surrounding area is touristy and thus quite pricey and busy- so this spot felt like even more of a find. Reasonably priced, great tasting, good portions and great stodgy puds. There are booths to sit in small groups and a wait for these is not long as food is served and payment is done at the counter- so you can be in and out in no time at all. Very pleased with my hot and filling chocolate pud with plenty of custard, but I was still to scared to try the cold jellied eels!. Traditional pie and mash with a few different filling options are available and even veggie version.

photos.caption: Photo of Goddards at Greenwich - London, United Kingdom. Choc pudding and custard #yum
Photo of Goddards at Greenwich - London, United Kingdom. Pie mash and gravy, jellied eels and pie, mash and liquor

8G3WaO2vfGUhZVVHefhyRQ.text: Best Pie & Mash in London. We actually cycled all the way from Angel for this! They have a great variety of pies which is not so common on traditional pie & mash, so nice for a change. I also really recommend their deserts. Generous portion and great quality!

0-2Pxqda1Se_AfLpXgsrOQ.text: Situated in the heart of lovely Greenwich, Goddards is an iconic english pie and mash shop, and the perfect place to grab a quick casual bite to eat. You have to queue and order at the counter, but the wait wasn't long. I'd suggest popping in here before venturing off to see the many attractions the town of Greenwich has to offer.  The prices are a bargain and we left feeling full and satisfied.  If the prices were higher, I'd have to take away stars from my review as this definitely isn't the best pie I've ever eaten.  I tried the chicken and mushroom pie with double mash and mushy peas. The pie was tasty, but the mash and mushy peas were a bit bland and could definitely be improved. I ordered double mash because I thought that meant 2 scoops of mash, but it turned out to be 4 scoops! The gravy was also a bit bland and there's a lot of it.  I would recommend adding Coleman's yellow english mustard to everything if you want to add more flavour to this value meal.

photos.caption: Photo of Goddards at Greenwich - London, United Kingdom. Bargain!
Photo of Goddards at Greenwich - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Goddards at Greenwich - London, United Kingdom

EvZdPZYIUSjZcPHdwXROBw.text: Deliciously simple pie and mash. Proper East London style pies served piping hot with mash and gravy or your choice of other sides and toppings. We just went there today after a stroll around the market and even though it was packed the line moved quickly and they serve you at the counter. It was great hearing the staff talk to locals and regulars. Very cool decor too, kept this place original. Recommend the steak and ale pie and mash with gravy! Mmmmmmm!!!

mq2seGS3QI1fouoIgjOo-w.text: Great place to grab a quick meal. The food was exactly what I expected. I got a beef + vegetable pie with mash and it was amazing. They also offered a vinegar based sauce that went really well with the mash potatoes. The service was very efficient and kind. All in all very satisfying meal.

FcBSlg6m8xI-3GXCnR3T7A.text: Three of us had different pies.  Two out of the three were good, including a vegetarian pie, which is hard to come by.  The price is right too.  Worth the visit.

photos.caption: Photo of Goddards at Greenwich - London, United Kingdom. Pie, mash and liquor

0N4vCF484OfLsk-1NahTeA.text: Had a cheap and cheerful dinner here once f those random evenings we were wandering around in Greenwich. Large selections of pies (had to wait a while for the steak and kidney pie). Place is pretty much a pub grub kinda place so don't expect anything fancy! Definitely will be going back there more often!

9mmtaqLMFiztW8C29NSIMg.text: Fantastic place. I took my parents there so they could try some traditional east London grub. I wasn't disappointed. We got some lovely pies with lashings of mash, smothered in gravy. They loved it. The prices were ridiculously cheap and we walked away with a noticeable waddle. Whilst not what you would call sophisticated food. This was exactly what we wanted. Good honest food. Keep up the good work guys!

o6x82zWRvKRtvnu6p3YBig.text: Yummy pies and mash. The pudding was a bit rich though, especially with the custard. There is seating upstairs and downstairs. Friendly staff! Student discount £.50 off pie & drink.

FcF3sJ-LkbIAwH7gof2yXA.text: An original pie and mash costs £3.80 and it comes either with gravy or liquor. Choose the one that suits you best for the day!

photos.caption: Photo of Goddards at Greenwich - London, United Kingdom. Pie and mash and lots of graaaaavvvvvyyyyy! Yeah :)

2HsFn367rLu-P_mWeF3nhA.text: In all honesty, I was a little disappointed. Firstly, the cleanliness. The place was a little grubby - tables, condiments on the table and chairs felt sticky - but Mr L told me that this was kinda expected. I looked at him dumbfounded, not sure if he was pulling my leg. He was serious. So I decided to ignore that and quickly tuck into my pie and mash, hoping that the food will make up for it. I chose the steak and kidney pie with mash (£4.40), laden with gravy. The kidney taste was strongly present but the filling only consisted of steak and gravy which I find was quite salty. The mashed potatoes and gravy had quite a floury taste and I am not sure what to make of it. Pastry, was a little burnt. Lunch was ok but was very ordinary.Goddard's has a reputation of serving up traditional pie and mash for over 100 years. The setting - nothing deluxe or lavish - also had that traditionalist aspect. It gave quite a nice welcome feeling as you walked in but when you are by the bar to order, make sure you already know what you want.  Both the queue and service moves quite fast and while the service was not abrupt, it was not particularly friendly. "Full range" on the menu means pies with mash where prices start from £3.90. Goddard's pies are quite a simple and regular lunch. I do suspect the big play on being traditional helps with their trade among the tourists in Greenwich.

photos.caption: Photo of Goddards at Greenwich - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Goddards at Greenwich - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Goddards at Greenwich - London, United Kingdom

7m08aBpes0tLwCDw6PKHRQ.text: Pie, glorious pie! If you're in need of a fix of perfectly crisp pie, get yourself down to Goddard's now!Excellent food, low prices, friendly and fast service, this pie shop has it all! I bring all of my foreign guests here for a taste of traditional British pie and they all leave full and satisfied. If you're familiar with traditional brown British gravy, I suggest trying their (non-alcoholic) herb-infused liquor sauce on your pie and mash. The mushy peas were not so mushy the last time I came but I'm glad I gave them another go as they were much better this time around. So happy I saved a little room for dessert as their rhubarb crumble with custard was out if this world!!! The next time I need a fix of pie, you know where to find me!

photos.caption: Photo of Goddards at Greenwich - London, United Kingdom. Rhubarb crumble with custard
Photo of Goddards at Greenwich - London, United Kingdom. Steak & ale pie with mash, mushy peas, and liquor
Photo of Goddards at Greenwich - London, United Kingdom. Pick your pie

fwe2eNzjq201oUns3tdxkg.text: Traditional pie & mash topped with parsley liquor along with sides of peas and eels. Supposed to put a lot of chili vinegar on top of it before eating. Amazing! I particularly liked the pie and the eel. Eel was so tender - loved it.

photos.caption: Photo of Goddards at Greenwich - London, United Kingdom

COxOIx_xAcHcnNxqXYT81Q.text: We were in London for four days, and ate plenty of pie and mash in that time. Found Goddards after we had walked through Greenwich Park to the Observatory and were ready for a bite to eat after all that walking. Out of all the pubs and pie shops we ate at in London, this was by far and away the best. Inexpensive, hot and fast, helpful people behind the counter who didn't hate us for being American, and just an all around great time. The pies were crispy and flaky, the mash was perfect, and don't let anyone tell you that British food doesn't have flavor! This place blew that stereotype out of the water! My American friends looking for good pie and mash in London, look no further!

6UlcfjtOUtJMtHZeQ0-ikw.text: This is a very quaint pie shop. Goddard's is a classic old English-style pub like pie eatery where there's a huge variety of pie fillings, flavours and accompaniments. I had the classic steak and ale pie with mash which I would give a 6/10 as what mainly let it down was the pastry which wasn't nearly as flaky as I would of hoped. All in all was a satisfactory meal but probably wouldn't go out of my way to eat here again.

photos.caption: Photo of Goddards at Greenwich - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Goddards at Greenwich - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Goddards at Greenwich - London, United Kingdom. Steak & ale pie with mash

fADIurbLF2FxyPAzmWQQeA.text: Yes yes yes! This place was top notch with 5 stars shining brightly!We got there just before 6pm on the Sunday just gone, and the two of us were lucky enough to get a table to ourselves. We knew what we wanted - pie and mash obviously! We were pleasantly surprised that it was only an extra 90p to add some mushy peas, so that was great! My boyfriend ordered us a steak and ale pie each, with mash and mushy peas each. I had a cup of tea (£1) and he had a bottle of Budweiser (£2.70). After he'd ordered it at the food bar, the lady behind the counter served it straight away, and there is sometimes nothing better than immediate and quick food!No waiting and low prices made the visit very successful, relaxing and enjoyable! We did try 1 jellied eel each for 50p, but they weren't for us ;-) The fish meat itself was okay, but the jelly around it was a bit strange. The pie, mash and mushy peas were so so great though, and the prices make it just sooo much better! You end up spending way way way under £10 per person, and I had about 2 cups of tea! Ooh, and I nearly forgot, we had the blackcurrant and apple crumble with custard for dessert, MMM! It was so delicious, especially with the side of ice cream I ordered, as well as the custard! It was a great visit and highly highly recommend it to anyone who loves pies and mash!!! x

photos.caption: Photo of Goddards at Greenwich - London, United Kingdom. Blackcurrant and Apple Crumble with Custard (Had to pay extra for ice cream too, but I didn't mind!)
Photo of Goddards at Greenwich - London, United Kingdom. Delicious Steak & Ale pie, with two scoops of mash, and mushy peas. You can see the jellied eel making an appearance too... and my cuppa!
Photo of Goddards at Greenwich - London, United Kingdom. Delicious Steak & Ale pie, with two scoops of mash, and mushy peas. You can see the jellied eel making an appearance too... and my cuppa!

laIpQhwUMfpxOuwfMWuWiw.text: I took the boat there just to visit this place and eat a great meat pie.  The woman behind the counter was very helpful and I got a plate of meat pie, mashed, and a nice ice cold beer for like 10 bucks!!It was worth the trip and the rest of the area is nice as well, so get on the boat at the embankment so you can see all the attractions, BBen, parliament, Tower Bridge, etc and get off in Greenwich for a couple hours, and make sure you find Goddards for a meat pie!

photos.caption: Photo of Goddards at Greenwich - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Goddards at Greenwich - London, United Kingdom

aAkcK9m_7J2B2E30biDXQQ.text: Must visit place to have pies and mash in Greenwich. Long line to get in to order your food but it is well worth it. Food is so cheap. Even have a kids menu for 3 quids. Lovely place right by the market.

photos.caption: Photo of Goddards at Greenwich - London, United Kingdom

NK5dBNS3kroeEXzCV5PVwA.text: Traditional meat pie and good sides. Overall a very filling meal especially for the low price.

Wbd7wAKNk2_j1aezKFs4mQ.text: Goddards was absolutely amazing! Great for groups and vegetarians. Busy but worth it, not much of a wait for food and very well priced! As an American, this was EXACTLY the kind of meal I wanted to experience abroad.

CrzTJiXnY9X1eOR7bom9Ww.text: We walked around and finally decided to eat here. And that may have been the shitties decision we did that day. We ate some kind of steakpie which i usually love but this was so discuting that none of us could finish our meels. (party of 4)We sat uppstairs and i guees the cleaning personal had the day of, it was plates and leavings as all over and rhe table we cleaned our self was really sticky. The only positive thing i can say is that the personal was nice and friendly.But maybe they just had a bad day when we were there...

photos.caption: Photo of Goddards at Greenwich - London, United Kingdom. Some kind of steak pie.. I guees.

6Nz2Klx1nQRuXfBgBLKk-A.text: Great pie and mash with traditional gravy.  Also has some lagers in bottles if you'd like.  The price can't be beat too!

photos.caption: Photo of Goddards at Greenwich - London, United Kingdom

Xa0e2th30FW1dy5K3ny_gg.text: My favourite pie n mash shop. They do a wide range of pies, which is unusual but the staff are lovely and the location is brilliant. It is cheap, working class food, which a few of the negative reviewers on here don't seem to understand, and I'd recommend the liquor with chilli malt vinegar. The puddings are great too

KW8nPbLOpCCSdVmZtj4Lhg.text: It's right on the edge of Greenwich Indoor Market, and I've walked past it a few times with their outdoor sign advertising "traditional pie, mash and jellied eels" and assumed it'd be tourist-ridden. Never assume. I ate at this place over the weekend. And let me tell you, they know good pie and mash (I can't vouch for the jellied eels but my parents enjoyed them). I only moved back to the UK a year ago after living abroad for a few years and I was always craving good old British pies so this place was like heaven to me. So many flavours of pies, and it will definitely not break the bank either! We had the steak and ale, cheese, and chicken and ham pies with mash and mushy peas. The pastry on all of them was fantastic with great mash and great gravy. The mushy peas weren't as mushy as I'd like...Too picky? Meh, maybe but will go without next time. I have to say I was also a little disappointed with the flavour of the chicken and ham; it was a bit bland but there were huge chunks of chicken in it. The flavour of the steak and ale was delicious. But my favourite? The classic cheese pie. There's nothing better than drowning a cheese pie in gravy (I'm Northern, we LOVE gravy). I will 100% be coming back here to try out more flavours of this British classic.

EPjlidaJF9OepRnQzwQI7Q.text: This is one fun British restaurant!Pies are the order of the day here - and their pies are absolutely first rate.However - the sleeper on the menu not to be missed are the eels.Ok - I'm biased. I kill for eels.If this is a Hitchcock thriller and a mysterious stranger needs me to do a dastardly deed - have him give me eels and I might be good for the business.That said - even with the soft spot in my heart for eels - these are very good eels indeed.(and I have been many places like some first rate eel restaurants in New York's  Chinatown - where - never mind the reputation - the eels were only ho-hum.) These eels really sing.They have a great fishy taste that stays with you in a nice way even after you have left the restaurant.The eels are served in "liquor" the special green sauce they put on pies and mash and peas and everything else.The combo is killer.One practical note. Here eels are a side dish - usually served along side pies and mash.(and in my humble American what-the-h-do-i-know manner ... i honestly don't see how eels go with a savory beef or kidney pie. Its like serving beef bourguinon with carp. - but its what they do.)since they serve it as a side dish - eel servings are small. If they are going to be your main (and I recommend this) - order a double or triple order.People at Goddards routinely order double or triple pies or double or triple mash - so no one will blink an eye at double or triple eel.Now what about the pies?Fantastic!The key feature of a pie is the crust.They do a suet crust that is knock your socks off addictive.They could a beef and building construction waste pie in that crust and you would eat it happily.The sauces are a deep beef gravy and the aforementioned "liquor".You can't go wrong either way.I sadly was not able to do dessert but I stared longingly longingly at the lovely crumbles and pies all served with one of the most seductive custards I have ever seen.If looks are anything like taste those things would have been dessert paradise.But I DID do the pies and the eels and one thing is certain.This is a restaurant not to be missed.If you are in Greenwich for a limited time and you MUST pick between Goddard's and the Observatory ...Skip the Observatory.Easy call.

vsMloAm2jMypGjjH7ogyjw.text: We had chicken & mushroom pie & mash, double pie and double mash, pie, mash and eels. It was good, but not amazing. Mash should have been a bit creamer and the pies should have been kept in the over another 5 mins or so. All meals are served with liquor or gravy. We all opted out for liquor and we happy with our election.  I had eel before but all at the sushi bars. This eel was cooked and reminded me of sardines. Can't say that I liked or disliked it, I was indifferent. The owner was super friendly with great recommendations and explanations. You have to order at the counter.  The menu is limited to pies and mash. For dessert we got apple crumble & black current with custard. Now that was amazing!  Not too sweet or too sour, just a perfect bland of textures and flavors. Tip: share a dessert, it's huge.

photos.caption: Photo of Goddards at Greenwich - London, United Kingdom. Pie, mash and eels
Photo of Goddards at Greenwich - London, United Kingdom. Black currant and apple crumble with custard. Amazing!

5wT1HaT22NVcR9OOpdyz1w.text: The people there were really nice and the place had great service as wellthe pricrs were cheap and affordable, only 2,5 pounds for an apple pie with icecream! definitely worth visiting if you plan to go to Greenwich

5Wccv23s3AZ4T-mWDWluOA.text: Meant to go here a couple of weeks ago, on our last trip up, but didn't make it. Having been before, I can thoroughly recommend the Pies..something else! They haven't moved too far from the old site. Greenwich is lovely part of the City and the food here makes a few days stay well worth it, well we've always thought so..Glad to here the Cutty Sark is back on

photos.caption: Photo of Goddards at Greenwich - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Goddards at Greenwich - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Goddards at Greenwich - London, United Kingdom

DV2qQTlxBaYIDWMil0vcSw.text: Traditional pie and mash shop, good portion size, friendly staff, excellent.

photos.caption: Photo of Goddards at Greenwich - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Goddards at Greenwich - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Goddards at Greenwich - London, United Kingdom. Pie, mash, mushy peas and liquor.

lhv7G-TAJoBCQve9ZG7_-Q.text: Best British food we've had on this trip in London so far. Steak and Ale pie, Sticky Toffee Sponge with Pudding for dessert and English beer. Wow!

dic8euR4yYuc9W_7KWLU8A.text: Hands down, my favorite meal from my London trip. We ordered a lamb and rosemary pie, and a steak and ale pie and washed it down with some ciders. Then dessert pies with ice cream. I recommend the upstairs seating area for a lovely view. With a restaurant like this, I don't understand how anybody could say that England does not have good food. These pies will be in my dreams, until next time!

2BKgamQ1HyxrdNTVjnU_Pg.text: We went for a visit in Greenwich and stopped in this institution for a quick bite.  We ordered the pie and mash with the mushy peas.  This hit the spot and allowed us to catch our breath while we planned our next location to hit while in Greenwich.  Can't mess with tradition -

photos.caption: Photo of Goddards at Greenwich - London, United Kingdom. Pie and mash menu
Photo of Goddards at Greenwich - London, United Kingdom. Pie and mash with mushy peas- loved this
Photo of Goddards at Greenwich - London, United Kingdom

1KovzMevRZOfwTkT33lnEA.text: This has been a regular stop for us when visiting London for many years. I love the food and atmosphere. When they were closer to the pier, I used to get the cheese and onion pie to go. Now I typically get the steak and ale pie to stay. The people are great and the food is fantastic. I just wish I had a regular supply.

XyWWgmShgmNBWNEbzWa9bg.text: If you're a tourist looking for a traditional/ authentic place to enjoy a hearty meat pie, look no further than Goddards. As cheap as 5 pounds, you can enjoy a delicious pie stuffed with all sorts of deliciousness and mash slathered in gravy. Be sure to try both the chicken and classic beef pie topped with gravy or liquor sauce! (Highly recommend one of each). Also, when it gets to be rich, try one of their homemade condiments such as the chili vinegar!

photos.caption: Photo of Goddards at Greenwich - London, United Kingdom. Homemade vinegars
Photo of Goddards at Greenwich - London, United Kingdom. Chicken and ham pie with liquor sauce, classic meat pie with gravy

Xs-ukQu4WVnoexPp7xWH0g.text: I absolutely love this place! They have been serving meat pies and mash since 1890! The chilli meat was fantastic, very old school but delightful

photos.caption: Photo of Goddards at Greenwich - London, United Kingdom

LgPo0QUyQWtH979QCQxcEw.text: This place was one of my unforgettable Greenwich experience! Never had traditional English pie before and i loved it. The service was very heartwarming just like how we received our pies. The pricing was inexpensive, if I could eat 2 pies because how cheap they charge each, I will - lol. The serving size was huge but if you are a big eater- a pretty standard size then. The delivery of the food was fast - I was not ready yet as I am too occupied taking photos and my name was called in less than 5 minutes. The taste - bland as how English food is known for but for a change- it was just right for me, besides it is how you want your pie be made - add more sides if needed but the one with  parsley sauce was what I enjoyed most. And by the way - their London pride beer was considered one of the best beer my husband has tried.  The place is small but the turn around was quick. They have second floor to backed up the number of customers trying to dine in. Tourists - highly recommended when you are in the area.

photos.caption: Photo of Goddards at Greenwich - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Goddards at Greenwich - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Goddards at Greenwich - London, United Kingdom

mIoNM0fGjZnU2QlWzOlCUQ.text: Found this after a walking tour and had to try the meat pie! Portion was huge and very delicious! Flaky crust and savory gravy. Counter staff is very friendly and helped us "yanks" order. Lots of locals stopping in.  It was easy to tell this is a favorite of nearby workers. Several varieties of pies. On our visit they were also offering gooseberry cobbler! Yum!

photos.caption: Photo of Goddards at Greenwich - London, United Kingdom

0fC5ZEtbkE4Za4rtyG4Izg.text: Excellent place for English food like mash, pies and pudding. It's a family run business since 1890. All pies are handmade and freshly made daily.

photos.caption: Photo of Goddards at Greenwich - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Goddards at Greenwich - London, United Kingdom

s4cc33zp5igD3pDcPokjjA.text: I came to the U.K. in search of great pies, and they fell below my expectations. I got the traditional pie, mash, and eels for 7.20£.  The pie here didn't have much flavor, and got soggy after it was drowned in the parsley sauce. The eels and mash were nothing special either. They put salt, pepper, and vinegar on the tables, but even they couldn't help much. The desserts looked pretty good though, so maybe those would have been a better choice.

photos.caption: Photo of Goddards at Greenwich - London, United Kingdom

CMszj-m4rMTZ-sj23QLqbw.text: Worth the trek out to Greenwich...London visitors, take the DLR our the Thames River Line and visit Greenwich's antique shops, the Cutty Sark, and Maritime Museum. Simply the best pies and mash in the U.K.

photos.caption: Photo of Goddards at Greenwich - London, United Kingdom. Double Pie & Mash with London Liquor (parsley-based) Gravy
Photo of Goddards at Greenwich - London, United Kingdom. Double Pie & Mash with Traditional Gravy
Photo of Goddards at Greenwich - London, United Kingdom. Menu - Their pie selection..

kmpO1lhgpqAF6ld8klufFw.text: Loved this place.  Good, cheap, comfort food.  My husband and I both had the beef pie with mash and gravy...only £4.20 each.  The crust was flaky and buttery and very good.  They had old church pews for benches at the tables which added to the ambiance.  My husband said it was the best meal he has had so far in England.

photos.caption: Photo of Goddards at Greenwich - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Goddards at Greenwich - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Goddards at Greenwich - London, United Kingdom

SHD7T-VGl8yu7sA0WiNqNw.text: Had pie, mash & liquor & really tasty & am a regular here now. The staff are nice & polite.

IjuMDvTB2vGkJuTx90JIUw.text: Absolutely the tastiest and cheapest pie and mash in London! Food authencity and quality is the best I had. If you are in Greenwich and looking for a typical English meal, I would highly recommend Goddards!

photos.caption: Photo of Goddards at Greenwich - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Goddards at Greenwich - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Goddards at Greenwich - London, United Kingdom

m7bgYqzlJjlvK32WHWvncw.text: I wanted to believe the hype with 4.5 stars on trip advisor, but I was sadly disappointed. I think trip advisor ratings are way too soft.   I ordered the chicken mushroom which was decent (3.5 stars) but not great.  My son ordered the double beef pie which had tasteless, watered down ground beef inside.  I admit the food is cheap by British standards and they gave large servings size, but if you have limited time in London, it was a waste of a precious meal opportunity.

om_L-NcOT48XlVkP5xusZw.text: OK, that was a fail. I have to say I never had a traditional English pie before and therefore I had very high expectations for Goddards considering the raving reviews - but maybe you have to grow up on this stuff, I don't know. In any case, I had the the beef pie with mash and liquor and it was just not good. The pastry was very hard and thick and the liquidy filling had very little meat - and basically no flavor... just like the liquor/parsley sauce. It seemed the cook didn't know that food needs seasoning. The only thing that tasted like something was the (instant?) mash. Maybe it would have worked better with the gravy, but with the parsley sauce the meal was one bland disappointment...

kBmjQjQ7k-DUAkMHf-hjWw.text: Great place for traditional London meal of pie mash and liquor. Beef pies as well as steak, chicken, and vegetarian. Jellied eels too! Friendly staff and cheap and authentic food.

photos.caption: Photo of Goddards at Greenwich - London, United Kingdom. Beef pie with mash and liquor sauce

pe6nB4CyzP6fd0yN-cISew.text: Was so hungry when I had the mince pie and mash. Warm and filling. Great service great food!

photos.caption: Photo of Goddards at Greenwich - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Goddards at Greenwich - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Goddards at Greenwich - London, United Kingdom

Ps9wZGSPc_27LCJUPRWl6w.text: Goddards at Greenwich is famous for serving London's most traditional meal of pie mash and liquor. This meal can be traced back through the 1800's and is an important part of London's food history. Goddards is still a family run business and has been serving pie and mash since 1890.Traditional 'Pie and Mash' really is a London only dish. It's funny, that although I live north of the river Thames, the ones you get in south London, always seem to taste better. Goodards is a good example of where you can get a good traditional 'Pie and Mash'. Although you can get steak, chicken, lamb and vegetarian pies here as an alternative to the traditional pie. If you go for an alternative pie though you are missing the point. Th real pie you have to try is the traditional pie made of 100% minced beef, with mash and liquor. Splash on some malt vinegar to give it that something extra. Don't spoil it by going for gravy, always go for the liquor. It's like a runny parsley sauce, but combined with the vinigar, it's to die for.By the late 19th century, there were over 100 Pie and mash shops in London. Nowdays they are much more difficult to find. I would urge any visitor to London, to try it as it really is a unique London only dish. Probably it's most famous fan is David Beckham, who goes to a Pie & Mash shop when he visits London for his favourite meal.When I host visitors to London, I always take them on the boat from Westminster Pier to Greenwich taking in the best views an commentary along the Thames, followed by a Pie and Mash lunch at Goddards whilst in Greenwich . It really can be the best day out, with a real London feel. For a decent meal for about £5, you can't go wrong!!

photos.caption: Photo of Goddards at Greenwich - London, United Kingdom. At 4.80, including tea. You can't get much better!
Photo of Goddards at Greenwich - London, United Kingdom. Traditional London food.
Photo of Goddards at Greenwich - London, United Kingdom. Pie n Mash with Liquor. London's finest.

3TJ77EnBH7t62NuFATW5kw.text: Greenwich by itself is a beautiful place and this place certainly matches the awesomeness. This place is recommended by major restaurant magazines as must try pie stop in London. The place is not that big, they have limited seatings. They have homemade pies which are just awesome.I just loved the chicken and mushroom pie.

1_XMDjq6mJUyyxAhCHrGyw.text: This is as authentic as meat pies get. Same joint, same recipe since 1890? Serve me up!Had the traditional mince meat, mash, peas, with both gravy and liquor. Service was friendly and ate in the upstairs dining room. Taste was a little bland but was expecting it as this had local taste bud popularity written all over it.
